pageContext.description: Two large concentric grooves in middle - wide rounded edge - Hollow below-Looped. Faces sharp and smooth, suggesting turning or rotary grinding (Evans). "The centre and raised bands though similar, are not identical in the 2, or it might have been thought that they were cast in a metal mould." (Evans).
pageContext.associations: Hoard of Late Bronze Age, Nos. 2451-2489, including Socketed Celts, spearheads, knives, small tools, ornaments, etc. For details, see No. 24551, socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Evans, Anc. Br. Imps., p. 400, fig. 499,H. Prigg, Journ. Brit. Arch. Assn. XXXVI, 56 ff, Fig. 15.,Inventaria Archaeologia, 1956, 3rd set: G.B. 17.
pageContext.collection: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford,Evans Collection, Nos. 1927-2482a, 2482b,(NB - 4 others found at same time).
